name: Hilton Philadelphia Airport

reviews.text: I decided to stay close to the airport the night before a 7:00 am flight and the Hilton was ideal. The location is five minutes from the airport and an easy drive. I found the desk staff very courteous and helpful. My room was clean and up-to-date and the shuttle service was timely. No complaints at all. I'd gladly stay there again.
reviews.title: Everything I needed

reviews.text: Hotel is badly in need of a makeover. Carpets are stained. Caulking in bathrooms is peeling. Paint is peeling in places. Air conditioning is from the early 1980's. However, the hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful - from the front desk personnel to the gentleman in the lobby offering free bottled water. So great staff but not so great hotel. Value was terrible as I had to pay the rack rate due to a large convention going on in Philly. If I had paid the normal $120 or so rate, value would probably be average. The bed was nice.
reviews.title: Dated hotel not up to Hilton standards - but very nice staff
Don't come in late!
reviews.text: I have a late flight and called the front desk to see how late I could check in. (I get in at 11:30 PM and have to pick up luggage and a car.) They said 1 AM. I called again to check and got a different answer (2 AM). Called a third time and got a different answer again.

To make matters worse I booked the room on Expedia and they charged my credit card twice! I called them and they said the room is non-refundable and Hilton would NOT authorize a refund for the duplicate charge. Had to call the credit card company and dispute the charge.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!
Best flight canceled stay ever
reviews.text: Haven't even stayed there yet and it has been a horrible experience. And very unsure that there will be anyone at the desk when I get there to check in.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a 2 night stay at the Hilton this past weekend. We got a late start and never checked into the hotel until 8pm. ! was given a drink coupon and a coupon for appetizers for both nights of our stay, as part of the Hhonors loyalty program. Dawn, at check-in told us the kitchen at The Landing restaurant at the hotel closed at 9, but the bar was open late.
reviews.title: Standard hotel, but not up to Hilton's Standards.

reviews.text: I wanted to secure a room on the top floor, the 9th floor, and contacted the hotel via their social messaging website. I had also requested an upgraded room. Our room was on the 6th floor. Called the desk and basically all that could be done was to move us to the 8th floor-standard/deluxe room, no upgrade. John, a guest ambassador, brought our keys up and took us to the 8th floor. He noticed my dismay with a standard room and offered to add points to my Hhonors account....an upgrade would have been more appreciated.
reviews.title: Standard Accomodations,

reviews.text: Room really was standard, it actually felt like a room at a Hampton Inn, size, and layout were identical to a Hampton Inn. A chair and ottoman competed the room. It was nice to see a safe in the closet.
reviews.title: Very Good Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By this time it was around 8:15--I went down to dinner and was told since the kitchen was only open till 8:45, I should put my order in asap. My first impression when I entered the restaurant was once you left your table, nothing was done to make it look presentable. I had asked to sit by the window and was cautioned that the area is used by the waitstaff for the bar. Our table had to to reset, since it was missing utensils. After traveling and room problems, all I wanted was to sit, relax, enjoy a cocktail and then order dinner. Waitress came back and asked if I was ready, reminding me of the kitchen hours, so I ordered. My husband was waiting to join me after he got some business calls taken care of. He sat down at 8:45 and placed his order. The food was fair. I ordered my steak with no butter/oil or salt or pepper. It came out with a seasoning and had a good amount of fat. I wanted a baked potato but the only 'starch' being offered was mashed potatoes-actually they tasted like they were mashed twice baked potatoes, very heavy on the cheese. Vegetable, I couldn't substitute a salad, so I had the broccoli spear. The glass of Cabernet I ordered had 4 fruit flies in it, so I sent it back.
reviews.title: Good for a Stop Over

reviews.text: Went to the bar to use a coupon and again, it seemed like no-one wanted to take the time to clean up. The popcorn area was a mess....tables had been left uncleaned. The bartender became flustered with all the glassware that had piled up. I mentioned, maybe she needed more help...lol...quite the opposite, she said they had too many workers there that night. Between the restaurant and the bar, my thoughts were "Doesn't anyone want to work anymore?" And sadly, the Beverage manager was in the area because he had to tell 2 patrons that they were 'cut off'. There was also either a security guard or policeman there...'just in case.'
reviews.title: Very good airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was very easy staff very nice and helpful. I asked for a room away from elevator and facing the airport. I was given room 907 King Room We were so tired from travel didnt noitce anything beds are nice wifii (free) works great flat screen tv with HD channels. Room showed age but looked good. On day two I noticed several ants by the AC and another on the carpet. I went down to lobby and was given another room on same floor room 925.After we moved all or stuff to 925 I turned on the light in bathroom and soon discoved we were not alone. There were atleast 5-10 ants crawing on floor called down to lobby and Manager came to room to see for himself. We moved again this time to room 809 no issues in that room the rest of the stay. We were given a free night and cocktails in the bar. The breakfast was good althoug not free.The pool was closed due to repainting the fitness area looked very nice with good equipment. I woould stay here again no issues after the ants.Check out was very easy. Although I did not use the airport shuttle left hotel about every 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Ants In First Two Rooms..Third Room No Issues Good Stay Other Wise

reviews.text: Stayed here on a business trip in August 2012. All hotels in Philadelphia downtown were either booked up or running $300 a night. This Hilton was reasonable @ $179. Distance to the city is roughly 25 mins by taxi ($28-$30). The hotel itself is nice but appears dated. It's a little "darker" & more stuck in the 90's than your average Hilton. The room itself was spacious enough and relatively up-to-date. Restaurant food was good but expensive. My only complaint with this hotel is that the walls are paper thin. Don't expect to sleep in because the doors start slamming at 6 AM, if not earlier. I was on the 13th floor and away from the elevators. Neither helped with the noise. As a business traveler, that needs to be fixed for a restful night. Maybe ask for an extra blanket and stuff it under the gap of the door. Other than that, the hotel has all the conveniences away from home. Staff was friendly overall. A good sports bar and restaurant round out a decent experience.
reviews.title: Average with lots of room for improvement

reviews.text: We took a girls trip last weekend. We flew into Philly and needed a place to stay for the night. I was excited to stay at a Hilton because heck it's a Hilton. We arrived in 2 groups and I was in the second group to arrive. The girls in the 1st group took the shuttle. This required 2 calls made to the hotel because a shuttle wasn't showing up, even after the first call was made. When they hotel staff was told that this was the second call they stated they had NO Record of a first call being made. Upon my arrival, the front desk staff was nice and had our keys waiting for us. The hotel is old but nice. The room was a nice size and four grown women fit comfortable in it; although, the beds were small.
reviews.title: Did not live up to it's name

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before we arrived the girls in the 1st group tried to order room service and were given 3 different numbers to call, all of which went unanswered, except for when the call was transferred to the bar and they were informed that they didnt do the room service. The gift shop and cafe were both also closed. With the hours that were given, they should have been able to get food and had to resort to ordering a pizza.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was something wrong with the bathroom door and would not open or close quietly. You practically had to body slam it. One of the plugs was not working properly and when there are only a few in the whole room, this is an issue. We ran out of towels and needed more, we had to call the front desk TWICE (again) before they were brought up. And when we called the second time we were told Oh he just got off and just must have forgotten to tell someone. As someone who works in the service industry this is NEVER acceptable!
reviews.title: OK but not great

reviews.text: The hotel staff @ reception were friendly & someone was always @ the front entrance to welcome you.
reviews.title: Not what expected from Hilton

reviews.text: The room we were in #630 was not up to Hilton standards. It was handicap but they put a huge handle bar in front of the vanity which made it impossible to use, so you could only use the sink area. The shower head was permanently mounted very low so you had ti bend over to wash your hair, we are both short. Lighting was terrible! In fact lighting in the entire room was awful!! They had a coffee maker in a corner where you couldn't see anything. I carry a small flashlight on my keys which I had to use. We couldn't even see to pack our bags.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff Good Value

reviews.text: Housekeeping never brought the correct amount of towels & washcloth. 4 days no washcloth,I had to call front desk. After complaining they brought 4 washcloths & no hand towels. There was a bottle cap under the desk upon our arrival & was still there when we checked out 5 days later.
reviews.title: Exceptional Commitment to Customer Service

reviews.text: The room itself was shabby. When you pulled back the curtains the wall was disgusting! (I'll post pics). The bed skirts had holes. The bed linens were very nice.
reviews.title: The 1970's called, they want their smoky-smelling hotel rooms back.

reviews.text: Very disappointed in a "Hilton" it seemed more like an economy hotel.
reviews.title: Not at all worth the money! Not a good name for the Hilton.

description: The Hilton Philadelphia Airport is an excellent hotel, providing comfortable accommodations and great service. The Hilton Philadelphia Airport is located adjacent to the Philadelphia International Airport, and offers a complimentary airport shuttle; a complimentary business center, where our guests can print boarding passes at their convenience; complimentary wireless high-speed internet in the guest rooms and lobby, and free parking for guests. The Hilton also offers the affordable Drive and Fly package for guests wanting to leave their cars while away on a trip, and features the Players Sports Bar with 13 HD televisions and a delightful menu of appetizing taste treats, pool tables, and video games. Enjoy a relaxed but stylish breakfast, lunch, or dinner in our Landing Restaurant, featuring an assortment of steaks, chops, and seafood for the discerning palate. Come visit!
